qas.question: Who funded the new telecommunications firms in Somalia?
China, Korea, and Europe lent what to the creation of the new firms.
What do the new telecommunications firms in Somalia offer that is not available in many other parts of the continent?

answers.text: affordable mobile phone and internet services

qas.question: Money transfers and wireless internet are two things that customers can now accomplish via what?
When the civil war began, many telecomunications companies were created to provide missing what?
Before the civil war, what jobs were being created?
Besides Somalia, what country has the best telecommunications?

plausible_answers.text: internet services that are not available in many other parts of the continent

qas.question: Why are the Somalian telecommunication companies so expensive?
What can customers do with their phones besides money transfers and banking activities?

context: After the start of the civil war, various <b6_0>new telecommunications companies<b6_0/> began to spring up in the country and competed to provide missing <a4_0>infrastructure<a4_0/>. Somalia now offers some of the most technologically advanced and competitively priced telecommunications and internet services in the world. Funded by <a0_0>Somali entrepreneurs<a0_0/> and backed by <a1_0>expertise<a1_0/> from <b7_0>China, Korea and Europe<b7_0/>, these nascent <b5_0>telecommunications firms<b5_0/> offer <a2_0>affordable mobile phone and <b8_0>internet services<a2_0/> that are not available in many other parts of the continent<b8_0/>. Customers can conduct money transfers (such as through the popular <b9_0>Dahabshiil<b9_0/>) and other banking activities via <a3_0>mobile phones<a3_0/>, as well as easily gain wireless Internet access.
